article_node.title: Nanofilm Technologies International First Half 2025 Earnings: EPS: S$0.002 (vs S$0.006 loss in 1H 2024)
article_node.summary: Nanofilm Technologies International has swung from a S$3.74 m loss in H1 2024 to a S$1.61 m profit, with a 1.5% margin and EPS of S$0.002, driven by higher revenue and a strong balance sheet (debt‑to‑equity 21.2%, interest coverage 20.1x). Forecasts project earnings growth of 17.7% and revenue growth of 8.6% per year, with a modest 4.8% return on equity in three years, while the company’s dividend has been adjusted to SGD 0.0033. Singapore’s market remains flat over the last week, with the utilities sector falling 16% but the overall market up 26% year‑to‑date; key contributors include telecom, energy, and financials. A list of 21 US stocks is highlighted as expected to yield over 6% next year, and the article notes that Singapore’s market valuation has risen to a P/E of 13.9x as of 15 Aug 2025.
